Vår kund söker nu en M365 System Engineer för området Digital Workplace.
   

  

 Uppdraget innebär att kravställa, följa upp och kvalitetssäkra deras leverans i samband med migreringen från onprem till M365.
   

  

 De kommer vilja göra mycket av det rent operativa arbetet kring M365 efter migreringen. Dock finns en extern leverantör till hands för rådgivning.. Under projektets gång behöver du kunna styra och vägleda leverantören och följa upp leveransen. Man behöver ha bra kunskap inom Intune, Entra ID, Exchange Online och förstå processen. Man blir lite av en produktexpert inom M365 i en liten IT-organisation.
   

  

 M365 kommer bli den nya samverkans plattformen. Migrera bort filservrar, gamla projektverktyg. Få in single sign on. Lite mer av en operativ arkitekt i början, men mycket hands on. Förstå hur man ska bygga för framtiden i M365 världen.
   

  

 Kompetens:
   

  

 Vi behöver någon som har tidigare varit med i ett projekt med en uppgradering från Onprem till M365, med bred kunskap inom:
   

  

* Entra ID
* Intune Exchage Online
* Teams, SharePoint etc.


 Efter implementering har man med fördel arbetat med att förvalta plattformen.

title: Backend Software Engineer
description:
*Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again and the aim is to create the next generation of bank, in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology. Do you want to join us and build the new Nordnet?*
**In brief**
 At Nordnet we want to democratize savings and investments by giving our customers access to the best tools and information whether you are a professional investor or a small saver. With modern technologies and speed of delivery, we are building the next generation investment platform.
   

  

**This is part of the role**
 Nordnet is a company with tech as the primary focus. In our agile and autonomous teams, you will be working with engaged colleagues that love to share their knowledge. As a developer at Nordnet, you will have the possibility to make an impact and create value for our customers with continuous releases several times a day.
   

  

**This is you**
 To succeed in this role, we believe that you take great pride in your work, are curious and continuously want to learn and grow. Collaboration and discussing ideas and concepts with your colleagues are things you enjoy and believe are important in order to build great products.
   

  

**As a Backend Software Engineer, You**
* Have experience of modern Java and Spring Boot
* Have experience of cloud development
* Have an interest in infrastructure as code and preferably experience in DevOps
* Design, develop, deploy and run Java services following good design and development practices
* Find the customer's importance and appreciate working closely together within a pure backend team, with stakeholders across the organization as well as outside 3rd-party vendors.
* Are a true team player that likes to share knowledge with your colleagues
* Love to automate, especially when it comes to testing
* Experience in high-performing, low-latency systems are preferred


 In this particular role, we believe you have an interest in savings and investments, and if you have worked in similar areas, it is even better.
   

  

**Nordnetters**
* Are proud of the friendly and humble environment
* Believe that the best code is written together and therefore appreciate pair/mob programming
* Continuously improve to ensure quality, making the code better with every release
* Commit to goals as a team, sharing the responsibility, success and failure


**What We Offer**
* Backend agile team which owns and maintains their product
* Your expertise and contribution will be appreciated from day one
* Plenty of opportunities to grow as an engineer
* Competitive salary and compensation


 We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues. Our teams are autonomous and embrace the agile way of working.
   

  

 Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.
   

  

 We are over 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen.
   

  

 Visit us on: www.nordnetab.com and https://career.nordnetab.com/pages/engineering
   

  

**Questions & applications**
 Apply today – we will start interviewing immediately. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.
   

  

 We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Solutions Engineer II (presales) - Cloud and Cybersecurity
description:
**Job Description**
**Are you passionate about Internet technologies and cloud computing?**
**Do you love helping customers overcome challenges?**
**Join our Solutions Engineering team**
 The PreSales engineering team is the technical partner to Sales. We provide unanticipated value and strive to provide the right solutions to our customers. Our team possesses the deepest levels of technical understanding and builds relationships to understand customer business drivers. We match these to Akamai's technology, and clearly articulating complex solutions to our customers.
   

  

**Shape the future of the Internet**
 We work with world leading companies in every major industry to make the internet fast and secure. As Solutions Engineer, you'll build relationships, becoming a trusted advisor to our customers, delivering innovative solutions. You will get to work with all the technologies Akamai has to offer. You will become an expert in Cloud and Cybersecurity.
   

  

**As a Solutions Engineer, You Will Be Responsible For**
* Growing revenue and acquire new business by evangelizing Akamai's technology to existing and prospective customers.
* Managing the technical proposal process and ensuring all technical information and recommendations addressing customer requirements are accurate.
* Engaging with customers during the sales-cycle to gather requirements and develop proposals, design, delivery, demo's and proof-of-concepts.
* Collaborating with internal Stakeholders to strengthen customer relationships by becoming the go-to person for technical queries.


**Do What You Love**
 To be successful in this role you will:
   

  

* Have experience in a technical pre-sales/sales engineering, consulting, or customer facing role delivering technical products or services.
* Demonstrate knowledge in Cloud and Internet technologies, including security solutions, compute, content delivery and web architecture (DNS,HTTP,TCP/IP,TLS).
* Have interpersonal savvy, a passion to solve problems, and a customer focused mindset.
* Have a thirst for learning and embracing new technologies.
* Be a good team player, able to collaborate, prioritize, and solve problems in a fast changing environment.
* Be fluent in both Swedish and English


**Work in a way that works for you**
 FlexBase, Akamai's Global Flexible Working Program, is based on the principles that are helping us create the best workplace in the world. When our colleagues said that flexible working was important to them, we listened. We also know flexible working is important to many of the incredible people considering joining Akamai. FlexBase, gives 95% of employees the choice to work from their home, their office, or both (in the country advertised). This permanent workplace flexibility program is consistent and fair globally, to help us find incredible talent, virtually anywhere. We are happy to discuss working options for this role and encourage you to speak with your recruiter in more detail when you apply.
   

  

 Learn what makes Akamai a great place to work
   

  

 Connect with us on social and see what life at Akamai is like!
   

  

**We power and protect life online, by solving the toughest challenges, together.**
 At Akamai, we're curious, innovative, collaborative and tenacious. We celebrate diversity of thought and we hold an unwavering belief that we can make a meaningful difference. Our teams use their global perspectives to put customers at the forefront of everything they do, so if you are people-centric, you'll thrive here.
   

  

**Working for you**
**Benefits**
 At Akamai, we will provide you with opportunities to grow, flourish, and achieve great things. Our benefit options are designed to meet your individual needs for today and in the future. We provide benefits surrounding all aspects of your life:
   

  

* Your health
* Your finances
* Your family
* Your time at work
* Your time pursuing other endeavors


 Our benefit plan options are designed to meet your individual needs and budget, both today and in the future.
   

  

**About Us**
 Akamai powers and protects life online. Leading companies worldwide choose Akamai to build, deliver, and secure their digital experiences helping billions of people live, work, and play every day. With the world's most distributed compute platform from cloud to edge we make it easy for customers to develop and run applications, while we keep experiences closer to users and threats farther away.
   

  

**Join us**
 Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!

title: Cloud Solution Architect: Endpoint (Windows 365, AVD, Intune)
description:
With more than 45,000 employees and partners worldwide, the Customer Experience and Success (CE&S) organization is on a mission to empower customers to accelerate business value through differentiated customer experiences that leverage Microsoft’s products and services, ignited by our people and culture. We drive cross-company alignment and execution, ensuring that we consistently exceed customers’ expectations in every interaction, whether in-product, digital, or human-centered. CE&S is responsible for all up services across the company, including consulting, customer success, and support across Microsoft’s portfolio of solutions and products. Join CE&S and help us accelerate AI transformation for our customers and the world.
   

  

 We are looking for a Cloud Solution Architect (CSA), specializing in cloud-based endpoint management and virtualization solutions, who is passionate about driving our customers’ AI transformation and enabling secure, AI-enhanced workplace experiences.
 **This is a customer-facing role that serves as a strategic trusted advisor and technical subject matter expert, ensuring seamless onboarding, adoption, and value realization across Microsoft’s endpoint solutions, including Windows 365, Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD), and Intune.**
 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Be a trusted advisor and drive business value through AI Transformation: Create business value by translating customer challenges into actionable solutions aligned to high ROI customer outcomes. Ensure a seamless, connected experience that fosters satisfaction, loyalty, and long-term value.
* Drive Customer Success: Lead architectural design, engaging with business and technical decision makers to drive intent and enable sustained usage of Windows 365, AVD, and Intune, securing long-term customer success and renewal.
* Explore growth opportunities: Partner with technical and sales teams to identify opportunities and develop tailored solutions to drive expansion and business value realization.
* Accelerate Customer Cloud and AI Endpoint Journey: Engage in relevant communities to share expertise, contribute to IP creation, prioritize IP re-use, and learn from others to help accelerate your customer’s AI transformation journey.
* Embrace a growth mindset: Act as the voice of the customer by proactively sharing insights, feedback, and success stories to inform internal strategy and execution.
* Learn-it-all: Demonstrate a self-learner mindset through continuous, self-directed learning in areas such as endpoint management, virtualization, AI integration, business value realization, and adoption and change management. Build and maintain technical readiness aligned to Customer Success Unit (CSU) priorities and corporate initiatives.


**Qualifications**
**Required Qualifications (RQs)**
* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, Liberal Arts, or related field AND several relevant years experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
* OR equivalent experience
* Deep technical expertise in Windows 365, Azure Virtual Desktop and Microsoft Intune running at Enterprise-scale.
* Proven track record of several years experience in working in a customer-facing role (e.g., internal and/or external) relevant to this role.
* Solid hands-on experience leading technical projects relevant to this role.
* Fluent in of both Swedish and English - Spoken and written.
* Currently based in Sweden.


**Preferred Qualifications (PQs)**
* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, Liberal Arts, or related field AND several relevant years experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
* OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND several relevant years experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting
* OR equivalent experience.
* Technical certifications in relevant technologies or disciplines (e.g., Azure Architecture and Administration, Microsoft 365 Endpoint Administration, Virtualization Technologies, etc.)


 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: SecOps Engineer
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most. With strong backing, a flat organization, and bold growth plans, we’re now looking for a SecOps Engineer to join us and shape the future of small business owners.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a SecOps Engineer at Qred, you’ll be a part of the enabler team, supporting our compliance team and cross-functional teams, working in a modern technical stack. We don’t only talk about AWS, serverless and machine learning, we are heavily invested in it. You will advise, collaborate, code and break stuff. Your daily work will probably include the following:
   

  

* You’ll be ensuring strong security in all aspects of platform operations.
* Supporting product teams in their ability to build and secure cloud distributed systems, serverless architectures and container platforms.
* Supporting IT with client security configuration, alerting and response
* Work with internal and external stakeholders to identify the company needs and requirements and implement the best practices in house.
* Be awesome and hands-on with AWS, IaC, tooling and coding/scripting (python or nodejs).
* Work with product teams to help drive security projects.
* Coordinate any security related issue, both planned and unplanned.
* Security audits of our integrations
* Troubleshooting and support of anything that touches our security related systems for the entire company
* Be or want to be knowledgeable on relevant compliance with technical touchpoints for our industry, EBA ICT guidelines or DORA compliance as an example.


**Here’s what we're looking for:**
* A self-driven person with a flexible, positive mindset and strong team spirit, who loves helping others.
* You can write secure code in at least one language (we use Python and Typescript) and are familiar with secure coding practices (e.g., OWASP).
* You have a passion for breaking (and fixing) stuff. You see what others don’t.
* At least a few years of experience working with security and/or cloud ops.
* Solid work experience in AWS and security, preferably in serverless.
* You’ve worked in regulated, compliant environments.
* If you have an AWS certification (Developer, Solution Architect or Sysops) we’ll be extra interested!


**Why join us?**
 Qred is growing fast, and our Qredsters along with it. With a non-bureaucratic organization and delegated responsibilities, we make sure there’s a short path from idea to action. In addition to our great culture, you get to work with the latest cutting-edge techniques offered by AWS, responsibility for the whole cloud architecture, and last but not least a bunch of new competent colleagues to learn from!
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. While we encourage a hybrid and flexible work setup, we do expect you to be in the office three days per week. Ideally, the role would be filled as soon as possible, but we’re happy to agree on a mutually suitable start date for the right candidate.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Marketing Assistant — MÅNELLA (Scandinavian Luxury Maison)
description:
**Location:** 
 Stockholm (Hybrid)
 



**Type:** 
 Internship (Pre-Launch, potential full-time after launch)
 



**Period:** 
 October–December 2025
 



**About MÅNELLA** 




 MÅNELLA is a Stockholm-born maison of celestial femininity — blending
 **Nordic purity, cosmic storytelling, and couture-level craftsmanship** 
 .
 



 We believe lingerie is not simply worn — it is a
 *ritual of self-connection* 
 , infused with the energy of the moon and stars. Our vision is to build a
 **Maison of Cosmic Intimacy** 
 , empowering women to embrace elegance, sensuality, and self-awareness through refined design and storytelling.
 



**About the Role** 




 We are looking for
 **Marketing Assistants** 
 to join our founding team during the brand’s pre-launch phase. This is a
 **creative, dynamic internship** 
 where you will work closely with the co-founders to bring MÅNELLA’s narrative to life through social media, influencer relations, campaign execution, and digital storytelling.
 



 This role is perfect for someone who dreams of shaping a luxury brand from its birth — someone with refined taste, aesthetic sensitivity, and curiosity about fashion, branding, and storytelling.
 



**Responsibilities** 



* Support the launch campaign across Instagram, TikTok, and Pinterest.
* Assist in influencer collaborations and partnership outreach.
* Coordinate content shoots, fittings, and pop-up events.
* Manage content calendars and ensure brand tone and visuals stay consistent.
* Conduct market and competitor research in luxury, fashion, and lifestyle.
* Collaborate with the creative and fashion design teams to align visuals and messaging.



**Requirements** 



* Deep interest in fashion, branding, and digital communication.
* Sensitivity to aesthetics — Scandinavian minimalism meets luxury femininity.
* Basic understanding of social media marketing and visual storytelling.
* Organized, proactive, and comfortable in a fast-evolving environment.
* Fluent in English



**Compensation & Growth** 



* This is an
 **unpaid internship during the pre-launch phase** 
 (October–December 2025).
* Interns who perform well will be offered
 **a paid position after launch** 
 , with salary adjusted based on experience and contribution.
* You will gain first-hand experience in brand building, strategy, and luxury marketing — working directly with the founders.

title: Data Security Specialist
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a data Security Specialist to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists in our Secure Infrastructure domain.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 350 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Data Security Specialist who wants to create advanced security solutions in our Secure Infrastructure Domain.
   

  

**Secure Infrastructure**
 Looking at the actual threat landscape today, it’s more important than ever to design and build infrastructure solutions that incorporate correct and relevant security features. The team works closely together using their combined knowledge and experience gathered from different projects and Incident Response cases to help our customers stay ahead of the threat actors. We continuously help customers improve their security posture within cloud, data center, endpoint management, identity, M365, networking and now Data Security.
   

  

**The Role**
 As the digital landscape continues to evolve, we see data security emerging as the next critical business area within cybersecurity. With the exponential growth of sensitive data being generated, shared, and stored across cloud platforms, organizations face unprecedented challenges in protecting their most valuable asset: information.
   

  

 As a Data Security Specialist, you will lead our efforts in data governance, information protection, and data loss prevention. Your work will be instrumental in safeguarding sensitive information and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements. You will take ownership of configuring and managing Microsoft Purview, building data security baselines, and deploying policies to protect critical assets. This role combines strategic planning with hands-on implementation, making you a key driver in our data security efforts.
   

  

**Your Potential Background**
* Practical expertise in configuring, managing, and optimizing Microsoft Purview for enterprise use.
* Strong understanding of data governance principles and experience implementing governance frameworks.
* Direct experience with deploying and managing Data Loss Prevention (DLP) policies and Information Protection tools.
* Background in designing security baselines or frameworks to support AI-driven projects.
* Hands-on skills in configuring and troubleshooting security tools and technologies.
* Familiarity with regulatory compliance requirements such as GDPR, CCPA, or similar data protection regulations.
* Proven ability to identify risks, assess vulnerabilities, and implement effective solutions.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


**Required Skills**
* Expertise in Microsoft Purview, including configuration, data classification, data lineage, and metadata management.
* Experience with Data Loss Prevention (DLP) solutions, including policy enforcement, incident investigation, and mitigation strategies.
* Proficiency in information protection tools, including encryption, rights management, and data labeling solutions.
* Strong knowledge of data security frameworks and ability to develop security baselines for AI-driven projects.
* Technical acumen for implementing and troubleshooting data security systems.


**Bonus Skills**
* Certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or Microsoft Certified: Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals.
* Experience conducting training sessions and workshops to educate employees on data security best practices.
* Familiarity with AI technologies and their unique security challenges.
* Knowledge of DevSecOps practices and integrating security into workflows.


*Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish/Danish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish/Danish work permit.*
**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you’ll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company – and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Senior Sales Manager – IT Staffing Services (Staff Augmentation Services)
description:
**Job Title:** 
 Senior Sales Manager – IT Staffing Services (Staff Augmentation) - Hunter Role
 



**Location:** 
 Sweden
 



**Experience:** 
 8–12 Years in IT Staffing / Business Development
 



**Employment Type:** 
 Full-Time
 



  





  





**Job Brief** 




 We are looking for a passionate and driven Senior Manager – IT Staff Augmentation to join our team in Sweden. This is a leadership role focused on new account hunting, business growth, and client success. You will take charge of driving IT staffing solutions, targeting enterprise and mid-market companies (especially in the Manufacturing and Automotive industries). If you are a hands-on leader with strong sales skills, deep client connections, and a proven record of winning new accounts in staffing services, this role is perfect for you.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




**Business Strategy & Growth** 



* Take ownership of the IT Staff Augmentation vertical with end-to-end accountability.
* Plan and execute strategies for expanding staffing services in the Sweden/European market.
* Design scalable staffing models tailored for enterprise clients.



  





**Sales & Client Acquisition** 



* Hunt and acquire new accounts, focusing on mid-market and enterprise companies.
* Engage with CXOs, CHROs, and procurement leaders to present IT staffing solutions.
* Build strong pipelines and create targeted go-to-market strategies for large clients.



  





**Network & Relationship Building** 



* Leverage existing industry connections to secure quick traction with enterprise clients.
* Convert relationships into long-term business partnerships.



  





**Talent Fulfilment & Delivery** 



* Work with talent acquisition and recruitment teams to deliver staffing solutions quickly and accurately.
* Ensure service excellence and client satisfaction at all times.



  





**Team Leadership & Collaboration** 



* Collaborate with recruiters, account managers, and delivery teams to ensure seamless execution.
* Foster a culture of performance, accountability, and client-first service.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Business, HR, IT, or related field (MBA is a plus).
* 8–12 years of proven experience in IT Staffing / Staff Augmentation Sales in Sweden.
* Strong network with HR, procurement, and business leaders in enterprise accounts (Fortune 1000 preferred).
* Demonstrated success in hunting new accounts and scaling staffing services.
* Knowledge of MSP/VMS models and workforce planning is an advantage.
* Experience working with ATS, CRM, and staffing platforms.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
* Self-motivated, target-driven, and able to work independently as well as collaboratively.
* Fluency in English (Swedish language is an advantage).



  





**Why Join Us?** 



* Be part of a fast-growing company with exciting global opportunities.
* Work on cutting-edge IT solutions that truly make a difference.
* Enjoy a culture that values your ideas, drive, and achievements.
* Build strong client relationships and make a visible impact in the market.
* Grow your career with support, recognition, and rewards for success.



  





**Application Instructions** 




 If you possess the qualifications and are driven to excel in your field, we warmly invite you to apply by sharing your updated resume at
 **resumes@empglobal.ae** 
 or by applying directly through this platform.
 



  





**Note:** 
 While we appreciate every application, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Thank you for your understanding!

title: Security Engineer EDR
description:
*Vi söker nu en Security Engineer med fokus på Endpoint- och sårbarhetsskydd till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm.*
 Som Security Engineer arbetar du operativt med att övervaka, förbättra och drifta säkerhetslösningar för våra endpoints – både klient- och servermiljöer – i syfte att upptäcka och hantera hot i ett tidigt skede. Du har en viktig roll i sårbarhetshantering, patchkoordination och teknisk efterlevnad, och verkar i nära samarbete med SIRT, driftorganisation och andra säkerhetsfunktioner.
   

  

 Arbetet innebär ansvar för lösningar som EDR, Vulnerability Management, loggplattformar och analysverktyg – samt deltagande i incidenthantering och säkerhetsutredningar. Du driver förbättringar av rutiner, dokumentation och tekniska kontroller, och arbetar kontinuerligt med att minska attackytor och öka motståndskraften i vår IT-miljö.
   

  

**Vem är du**
 Du har ett säkerhetstänk som spänner över både infrastruktur och applikation, och är van vid att arbeta i komplexa IT-miljöer med höga krav på säkerhet och tillgänglighet. Ditt arbetssätt präglas av struktur, analys och ett starkt fokus på att förebygga och hantera tekniska hot mot verksamheten.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med EDR-lösningar såsom Defender eller SentinelOne, och är bekväm med sårbarhetshantering och endpointskydd i både Windows- och Linuxmiljöer. Du har god förståelse för malwarebeteende, logganalys och incidentrespons, samt insikt i vilka säkerhetskrav som ställs på drift av klienter och servrar. Det är meriterande om du har certifieringar inom cybersäkerhet, såsom CompTIA Security+, GIAC eller CISSP.
   

  

**Mer information och ansökan**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit.
   

  

 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230 alternativt Jenny Nilsson: jenny.nilsson@nexergroup.com eller +46 703 018 279.
   

  

 Läs mer om tjänsten och ansök här.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar. Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
   

  

 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Senior AWS Professional Services Delivery Manager
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a highly skilled and versatile Engagement Manager (EM) to join our team and lead the delivery of complex cloud solution projects.
   

  

 In this role you will combine technical expertise with strong project leadership skills to drive successful implementations of AWS-based solutions for our clients. You will bridge business requirements with technical solutions, facilitating technical discussions and ensuring alignment with customer outcomes. Applying AWS frameworks like Well-Architected and Cloud Adoption Framework while demonstrating technical credibility across diverse stakeholders, you will distill customer needs into clear technical requirements, decompose complex problems, and make informed trade-off decisions considering performance, scalability, security, and business impact.
   

  

 Possessing strong technology and program/project management experience, you will validate technical solutions against business goals, recognize when additional technical evaluation is needed, and manage technical risks. You will be expected to achieve and maintain relevant AWS certifications, develop domain-specific expertise, and effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and business audiences. As you progress, you’ll lead increasingly complex technical projects, shape cross-organizational technical strategies, and establish best practices in your domain. In this role you will apply your management and leadership capabilities to successfully execute project plans, proactively identify and manage risks, resolve issues, escalate when appropriate, and drive projects to successful completion, while exceeding customer expectation The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud.
   

  

 We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**Eligibility Requirement**
* This role requires you to be a Swedish National and have business level proficiency in the Swedish language


 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Architect and execute enterprise-level IT projects with precision, managing multiple concurrent initiatives
* Facilitate agile methodologies to streamline project delivery and enhance team productivity
* Develop comprehensive project strategies that align technological solutions with business objectives
* Coordinate cross-functional teams to ensure seamless communication and project alignment
* Implement cloud service solutions that drive operational efficiency and technological innovation


 A day in the life
   

  

 AWS Global Services includes experts from across AWS who help our customers design, build, operate, and secure their cloud environments. Customers innovate with AWS Professional Services, upskill with AWS Training and Certification, optimize with AWS Support and Managed Services, and meet objectives with AWS Security Assurance Services. Our expertise and emerging technologies include AWS Partners, AWS Sovereign Cloud, AWS International Product, and the Generative AI Innovation Center. You’ll join a diverse team of technical experts in dozens of countries who help customers achieve more with the AWS cloud.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 8+ years hands-on Project Management experience managing enterprise-level IT projects
* 5+ years of experience in cloud computing.
* Proven track record of successfully managing multiple concurrent projects and demonstrated expertise in leading teams using agile approaches
* Strong understanding of cloud service value propositions
* Proficiency with project management and agile toolsets


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Active project management certification
* Experience managing large-scale technical projects
* Deep knowledge of agile and scaled program management practices
* Experience delivering IT engagements for large enterprise customers
* Proven ability to communicate effectively with executive and technical leadership


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A3025193

title: Business Development & Offering Manager
description:
*Omegapoint är norra Europas ledande techbolag inom cybersäker digitalisering. Tillsammans med våra kunder bygger vi digitala verksamheter som är resilienta från grunden. Vi erbjuder allt från strategisk rådgivning vid komplexa utmaningar till helhetsåtaganden inom cybersäkerhet och digitalisering. Vårt uppdrag är att skapa säkra IT-system och lösningar, effektivisera processer, skydda mot cyberhot, hantera lagkrav och bli mer hållbara i en digital värld.*
**Om rollen**
 Vi söker en ambitiös, nyfiken och resultatorienterad person till rollen som
 **Business Development & Offering Manager** 
 . Rollen passar dig med bakgrund inom managementkonsulting som vill ta nästa steg och kombinera strategiskt tänkande med konkret affärsutveckling.
   

  

 Rollen är en del av bolagets nya Commercial-funktion och ingår i dess ledningsgrupp.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta nära företagets ledning för att:
   

  

* Utveckla och paketera kundanpassade erbjudanden baserade på vår djupa expertis och erfarenhet
* Identifiera och utvärdera nya affärsmöjligheter som möter kunders behov och bolagets utveckling
* Stötta strategiska initiativ som driver tillväxt och vår position på marknaden


**Ansvarsområden**
**Erbjudandeutveckling**
* Konsolidera och vässa vår portfölj för att skapa tydlig struktur och effektiv portföljledning
* Skapa relevant och vasst säljmaterial i samarbete med interna team
* Öka den analytiska förståelsen för tillväxt- och lönsamhetspotentialen i vår erbjudandeportfölj
* Bygga business cases och go-to-market-strategier för nya tjänster eller produkter
* Översätta komplexa idéer till tydliga, strukturerade och säljande kundlösningar


**Affärsutveckling**
* Analysera marknadstrender, konkurrenslandskap och kundbehov
* Identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter med interna team
* Ta fram skräddarsydda förslag, presentationer och marknadsmaterial för strategiska kundengagemang
* Stötta arbetet med säljpipeline och kunddialoger


**Strategiska Projekt**
* Genomföra gedigna analyser och utveckla rekommendationer
* Driva tvärfunktionella processer för att säkerställa framdrift


**Kvalifikationer**
**Bakgrund**
* 2–5 års erfarenhet från ledande managementkonsultfirma, corporate strategy eller annan analytiskt krävande miljö
* Högskoleexamen inom teknik eller ekonomi


**Färdigheter**
* Stark analytisk förmåga och skicklig problemlösare
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter (muntligt, skriftligt, visuellt) på svenska och engelska
* Affärsmässigt och strategiskt tänkande
* Hög grad av självständighet, initiativförmåga och driv
* Stark förmåga att samarbeta med olika funktioner och kollegor i hela organisationen


**Personlighet**
* Entreprenöriell och nyfiken, trivs i en föränderlig miljö
* Samarbetsorienterad med stark potential att ta ledarskap
* Snabb och resultatfokuserad
* Analytisk och strukturerad i tanke och arbetssätt


**Vi erbjuder**
**Hos Oss Får Du**
* Vara en del av ett bolag med tydligt syfte och ambition att göra samhället säkrare
* Nära samarbete med ledningen och möjlighet att påverka företagets tillväxtresa
* En nyckelroll i att utveckla och paketera framtidens erbjudanden
* En dynamisk och snabbfotad arbetsmiljö som värdesätter intellektuell skärpa och kreativitet
* Marknadsmässig ersättning och goda utvecklingsmöjligheter


**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Har du några frågor kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta
 **petra.soderberg@omegapoint.se.**

title: Research assistant in the field of human tumor immunology
emails: jenny.mjosberg@ki.se, jenny.mjosberg@ki.se, jenna.almqvist@ki.se, jenna.almqvist@ki.se, peter.svensson@ki.se, peter.svensson@ki.se, mari.gilljam@ki.se, mari.gilljam@ki.se, elizabeth.valenzuela@ki.se, elizabeth.valenzuela@ki.se
description:
**Do you want to contribute to top quality medical research?**
*We are looking for a research assistant to join our supportive and skilled team. We offer a stimulating environment with the possibility to learn new cutting-edge immunological techniques in a rapidly moving research frontier. This employment is a special fixed term employment (SÄVA) for a maximum of 12 months.*
 The Mjösberg group studies the differentiation, regulation and function of innate lymphoid cells (ILCs) and T cells in humans, and how these cells contribute to pathology in mucosal organs such as the gut and airways (https://ki.se/en/medh/clinical-lung-and-allergy-research-unit-claru). The studies are translational as they involve advanced basic molecular and cellular immunological investigations of precious human tissue samples to discover novel disease mechanisms, therapy targets and biomarkers. The group is internationally recognized in the field through several high impact publications in recent years.
   

  

**Your mission**
 The main responsibilities for the research assistant will be to support the group’s work with research on human gut tissues including gut tumor materials. The duties will be tissue dissection, biobanking, isolation of lymphocytes as well as flow cytometry and single-cell RNA-sequencing analysis together with PhD students and postdocs in the lab. Also other experimental methods will be used, such as tissue sectioning and downstream analysis. The candidate will also support our lab manager in maintaining a good laboratory work environment, ordering, organizing databases and data sets. It is expected that the applicant participates in project meetings, support students and other researchers in their work, as well as contribute to common lab duties.
   

  

**Your profile**
 The candidate must hold a Master’s degree in the field of biomedicine, medicine or immunology when the position starts.
   

  

 The candidate should have experience with human tissue processing, isolation and culture of primary immune cells. It is a merit to have skills in multidimensional (>20 parameters) flow cytometric analysis and sorting as well as multiplex immunohistochemistry and microscopy. Experience in management of datasets and databases is a merit.
   

  

 The candidate should be self-motivated and be eager to learn and take on new tasks in a dynamic research environment. The candidate should have good communications skills and a proven ability to interact effectively and work productively in an interdiciplinary team. The applicant must have excellent organizational skills, be accurate and flexible, and have the ability to work efficiently to meet deadlines as well as being able to multitask. We place great emphasis on personal suitability for this role.
   

  

 Fluency in English is a requirement as well as some basic skills and willingness to learn Swedish.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 A creative and inspiring environment with wide-ranging expertise and interests. Karolinska Institutet is one of the world's leading medical universities. Our vision is to pursue the development of knowledge about life and to promote a better health for all. At Karolinska Institutet, we conduct successful medical research and hold the largest range of medical education in Sweden. Karolinska Institutet is also a state university, which entitles you to several good benefits through our collective agreement. And you get to practice freely in our modern wellness facilities, where trained staff are on site.
   

  

****Location:****
*Flemingsberg*
*Read more about the Department of Medicine, Huddinge (MedH)*
*Choose to work at KI – Ten reasons why*
**Application**
 Welcome to apply at the latest 2025-10-31
   

  

 The application is to be submitted through the Varbi recruitment system.In this recruitment, you will apply with your CV without a personal letter. Instead, you will answer some questions about why you are applying for the job in the application form.
   

  

**Want to make a difference? Join us and contribute to better health for all**
 Anställningsform: särskild visstidsanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Flemingsberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: STÖD 2-3754/2025 | Kontakt: Jenny Mjösberg, Recruiting manager jenny.mjosberg@ki.se, Jenny Mjösberg, Rekryterande chef jenny.mjosberg@ki.se, Jenna Almqvist, HR-Partner jenna.almqvist@ki.se, Jenna Almqvist, HR-Partner jenna.almqvist@ki.se, | Facklig företrädare: Peter Svensson, SACO peter.svensson@ki.se, Peter Svensson, SACO peter.svensson@ki.se, Mari Gilljam, OFR mari.gilljam@ki.se, Mari Gilljam, OFR mari.gilljam@ki.se, Elizabeth Valenzuela, SEKO elizabeth.valenzuela@ki.se, Elizabeth Valenzuela, SEKO elizabeth.valenzuela@ki.se, | Publicerat: 2025-09-26 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-10-31

title: Tacton modeler/ developer, Finnspång
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 Our mission is to streamline the Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ) processes by leveraging the power of Tacton modeling platform, ensuring accurate and efficient product configurations, pricing, and quoting to drive business growth and customer satisfaction.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements for product configuration needs.
* Design, build complex product configuration models in Tacton CPQ to meet business and customer requirements.
* Configure pricing rules, discount structures, and quote generation processes within the Tacton platform.
* Continuously optimize and improve existing configuration models for efficiency and scalability.
* Develop solutions that support, enables, and drives front line sales teams within Sales to sell better, faster, reliable, consistently and more efficiently.
* Coordination and management of gathering information for implementation projects from various business stakeholders.
* Be a crucial part of a cross-functional development team (IT programmer, Tacton modelers, Engineering, Sales, Management, External Consultants) to achieve the set project objectives
* Run projects in an agile manner, by gathering information, clarifications and continuously seeking feedback from front line sales, R&D, finance team during solution development.
* Test and validate product configurations to ensure accuracy and reliability.
* Current on industry best practices and trends related to CPQ and Tacton modeling.
* Provide technical expertise and support to sales teams in using Tacton CPQ for quoting and proposal generation.


**Requirements:**
* Master or Bachelor’ degree in Engineering, Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent working experience with proven skills in fields relevant for mastering the role.
* Minimum 5 years working experience with Tacton CPQ platform development in S-E or other companies.
* Proven experience working with CPQ systems, with specific expertise in Tacton modeling.
* Strong understanding of product configuration principles and best practices.
* Proficiency in translating business requirements into technical solutions within the Tacton platform.
* Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills.
* Skilled communication and collaboration abilities to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Ability to prioritize tasks, manage workload efficiently, and meet project deadlines.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Certifications for Tacton CPQ or similar configuration tools.
* Can set up a Tacton configuration model with product knowledge, data, and processes.
* Can maintain the modeling part of a Tacton Configurator project on their own.
* Expert with CRM systems and integration with CPQ tools.
* Expert of ERP systems and their interaction with CPQ solutions.
* Deep knowledge of object type hierarchies
* Experience of the more advanced and powerful concepts and tools available in TCStudio
* Modeling with attributes features and constraints
* Tacton Constraint Language (TCL) Expert in implementing sophisticated logic to manage diverse product configurations and pricing scenarios. Can express complex business rules and constraints.
* Language : Swedish preferred and English mandatory
* 5 years experience with Tacton modeling is ideal
* Optional: Programming skills in VBA, JavaScript or R is an advantage to implement new features in the cost price visualization in Excel to sales managers. Skills in Jira dashboards, boards design, improvements and maintenance


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Pris- och Masterdata Specialist – Dynamics 365 till vår kund
description:
Uppdraget innebär ett nära samarbete med affärs- och säljteam, där du ansvarar för prissättning, artikeldata samt bidrar i förbättringsprojekt kopplade till vårt ERP-system Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Supply Chain Management.
   

  

 Som konsult kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att säkerställa korrekta priser, uppdaterade artikelregister och effektiva processer som stödjer kundens försäljning och marknader.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

**Prissättning**
* Skapa, uppdatera och administrera prislistor i ERP-systemet
* Hantera prissättning av nya artiklar i samarbete med försäljningsorganisationen
* Stödja kampanjprissättning och säkerställa att prissättningsflöden fungerar korrekt i systemet
* Analysera och följa upp prisnivåer i relation till marknadspriser och marginalmål
* Säkerställa korrekt information till kunder vid prisjusteringar och nya artiklar


**Masterdata**
* Underhålla och kvalitetssäkra artikel- och prisdata i ERP-systemet
* Registrera nya artiklar och uppdatera artikelinformation löpande
* Hantera information om nya, ersättande och utgående artiklar
* Bidra i förbättringsprojekt kopplade till masterdata och prissättningsprocesser


 Vi söker en konsult som har
   

  

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Supply Chain Management (tidigare D365F&O) eller liknande ERP-system
* God förståelse för prissättnings- och artikelhanteringsprocesser
* Förmåga att arbeta strukturerat, noggrant och självständigt
* Stark analytisk förmåga samt intresse för att bidra till processförbättringar


**Omfattning: 100%**
**Språk: Svenska**
**Vänligen ansök snarast med:**
* Ditt uppdaterade CV
* Timpris (inkl. omkostnader)
* Tillgänglighetsdatum
* En kort motivering varför du är lämplig uppdraget.

title: Senior Accountant
description:
På Svea Solar har vi en tydlig vision - att fixa planeten. Som Sveriges och en av Europas ledande aktörer inom energiteknik driver vi på energiomställningen med solenergi och smarta energilösningar. ⚡
   

  

 Nu söker vi en
 *Senior Accountant till vårt Accounting-team* 
 . Är det du?
   

  

 Om rollen & teamet
   

  

 Det senaste året har Svea Solar tagit stora kliv i sin finansiella mognadsresa – från ett start-up-fokus till att arbeta mer strukturerat med lönsamhet och kostnadskontroll. Resultatet? Vi har redan nått lönsamhet i tre av våra fyra marknader och siktar på att samtliga marknader ska vara lönsamma under 2025.
   

  

 I denna transformation spelar vårt Accounting-team en nyckelroll. Accounting-teamet har särskilt fokus på att kvalitetssäkra processer och leverera stabila underlag till controlling, så att hela organisationen kan fatta ännu bättre beslut.
   

  

 På senare tid har fokus legat på att etablera rutiner för hur vi arbetar med de nyligen implementerade systemen, såsom Cognos och Adra, för att minska manuellt arbete och skapa mer spårbara processer. Teamet har dessutom påbörjat arbetet med en ekonomihandbok som ska stödja ett enhetligt och effektivt arbetssätt.
   

  

 Du blir en del av ett team med stark ”do it together”-anda, där både kultur och samarbete värderas lika högt som siffrorna. Som Senior Accountant får du aktivt möjlighet att påverka teamets kultur och sättet vi arbetar tillsammans. Ett konkret exempel är vår kulturworkshop hemma hos Interim Head of Group Accounting, Titti, där teamet delade erfarenheter, satte gemensamma mål och avslutade dagen med en After Work.
   

  

**Dina Ansvarsområden**
* Ansvara för månads-, kvartals- och årsbokslut för moderbolaget
* Upprätta årsredovisningar och deklarationer
* Säkerställa att redovisningen följer gällande lagar och regler (K3, IFRS m.fl.)
* Delta i utveckling och effektivisering av processer och rutiner för att öka kvaliteten på output
* Vara kontaktperson gentemot revisorer och myndigheter
* Stötta och vägleda kollegor i redovisningsfrågor


 🌍 Life as a Power Shifter - Vad erbjuder vi dig
   

  

* Möjligheten att Make an Impact – ditt arbete bidrar direkt till att fixa planeten och driva energiomställningen.
* En värderingsdriven arbetsplats - läs mer om våra värderingar här.
* Chansen att äga dina resultat - väx, ta ansvar och power up i takt med att vi och energibranschen utvecklas.
* En inkluderande kultur - olika perspektiv driver innovation, hos oss kan du vara dig själv och bidra med dina erfarenheter, identiteter och idéer.
* Trygga villkor - Tjänstepension, 30 semesterdagar, friskvårdsbidrag, parkering m.m.
* Flexibilitet/hybridarbete - jobba upp till två dagar i veckan hemifrån.


 Vill du se hur livet hos oss faktiskt ser ut? Följ oss på Instagram: @LifeAtSveaSolar
   

  

 Är vi en match?
   

  

*Vi söker dig som...*
* Har erfarenhet av att självständigt upprätta månadsbokslut, kvartalsbokslut och årsbokslut.
* Har goda kunskaper inom moms- och skattefrågor.
* Har en mycket god förståelse för redovisningsprinciper, K3 och IFRS.
* Har erfarenhet av att upprätta och granska inkomstdeklarationer och årsredovisningar.
* Har goda kunskaper i Excel, exempelvis har du förmåga att skapa pivotabeller.
* Har en relevant utbildning – meriterande med ekonomiskt inriktad universitetsutbildning, alternativt lägst YH-utbildning inom ekonomi/redovisning.
* Har ett genuint intresse för redovisning och vill arbeta med och utvecklas inom accounting.
* Behärskar svenska och engelska mycket väl, både i tal och skrift.


**Som Person Är Du Du**
* Lösningsfokuserad och noggrann.
* Prestigelös och stöttar gärna kollegor i teamet med enklare uppgifter, såsom reskontra, samt erbjuder hjälp när någon behöver det.


 Listan kan kännas lång, men ingen är bäst i alla kategorier. Sök om du känner igen dig någorlunda 😊 Hos oss finns möjligheten att Power up - vi lär dig nya skills här!
   

  

 ⚡Vilka vi är
   

  

 Svea Solar är en av Sveriges - och en av Europas - ledande aktörer inom energiteknik samt leverantör av solenergi och smarta energilösningar. Vi hjälper våra kunder att optimera sin energianvändning med solpaneler, värmepumpar, batterier, laddboxar, elavtal och vår egen mjukvara.
   

  

 Vi kallar det
 **The Power Shift.** 
 Och vi som driver det framåt?
 ****Power Shifters** 
 .**
 Om vår rekryteringsprocess
   

  

* Alla kandidater bedöms på lika villkor, med strukturerade frågor och tester via Alva Labs för att säkerställa en rättvis och inkluderande process - Diversity is key!
* Läs mer om vår rekryteringsprocess här.


 👉 Redo att bli en Power Shifter? Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande, så vänta inte med att skicka in din!

title: Field Application Engineer FPGA
description:
Are you looking for a unique opportunity to be a part of something great? Want to join a 17,000-member team that works on the technology that powers the world around us? Looking for an atmosphere of trust, empowerment, respect, diversity, and communication? How about an opportunity to own a piece of a multi-billion dollar (with a B!) global organization? We offer all that and more at Microchip Technology, Inc.
   

  

 People come to work at Microchip because we help design the technology that runs the world. They stay because our culture supports their growth and stability. They are challenged and driven by an incredible array of products and solutions with unlimited career potential. Microchip’s nationally-recognized Leadership Passage Programs support career growth where we proudly enroll over a thousand people annually. We take pride in our commitment to employee development, values-based decision making, and strong sense of community, driven by our Vision, Mission, and 11 Guiding Values; we affectionately refer to it as the
 *Aggregate System* 
 and it’s won us countless awards for diversity and workplace excellence.
   

  

 Our company is built by dedicated team players who love to challenge the status quo; we did not achieve record revenue and over 30 years of quarterly profitability without a great team dedicated to empowering innovation. People like you.
   

  

 Visit our careers page to see what exciting opportunities and company perks await!
   

  

**Job Description**
 As an FPGA Field Application Engineer (FAE), you will engage with clients to create technical solutions while identifying and building new business using your engineering expertise. You will be expected to reframe their thinking and build consensus for Microchip’s solutions, co-creating value by delivering the freedom to innovate.
   

  

**The Role Responsibilities Are**
* Provides pre-sales and post-sales technical support for the development and implementation of complex products, applications, and solutions across all Microchip product lines, with an emphasis on FPGAs.
* To be an authority on all phases of programmable logic design, including requirements analysis, HDL code development and simulation, embedded hard and soft processor system design, synthesis optimizations, place and route constraints, timing closure, board-level schematic reviews, and FPGA hardware development and debug tools.
* Advise on the implementation of innovative ideas and solutions for assigned clients.
* Utilize engineering design skills, techniques, and knowledge to help the client decrease time to market, reduce overall system cost and improve end-product performance.
* Utilize the Microchip Client Engagement Process to drive design wins to revenue at assigned clients
* Use insight and influencing skills to offer clients unique perspectives on technology that links to Microchip solutions.
* Identify key client stakeholders and coach them to build consensus for Microchip solutions within their organization.
* Contribute and participate within a global team environment to successfully develop and implement strategies for assigned clients across all global locations.
* Communicate effectively with Microchip Business Units for technical assistance and provide quantifiable feedback to measure ROI in assigned client investments (solutions and products).
* Coach, mentor, and train other FAEs as needed.
* Assist launches of new product introductions.


**Requirements/Qualifications**
* 5+ years of relevant industry experience with FPGA-based architecture definition, design, and support, includingHigh-Speed Serial IO and/or Embedded Processor.
* 5+ years of experience with lab equipment such as oscilloscopes and signal analyzers.
* 5+ years of experience in semiconductor applications/sales.
* Strong problem-solving and debugging skills, with the ability to work in a matrixed team environment.
* Familiarity with aerospace products and designs are a bonus.
* A Bachelor's Degree, or higher, in Electronics Engineering or Computer Science with a strong academic track record.
* Embedded Linux knowledge is a plus.
* Must be able to speak and write in English fluently.


 Competencies
   

  

* Strategic/Critical Thinking—Systematically solves problems and hypothesizes possible client pain points, expectations, and implicit needs; brainstorms with team members to devise solutions to solve complex client challenges.
* Communication—Tailors communication to the client’s needs with authority; effectively delivers presentations and has strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Interpersonal Influence—Uses rational and emotional drivers that would appeal to clients to drive conversations to elements of value for both parties.
* Networking—Identifies the right client stakeholders and builds connections quickly to drive consensus for design wins; works cooperatively with a wide range of internal stakeholders for success.
* Ownership—Goes out of his or her way to complete a task and has a relentless drive to achieve results; is independent, self-directed, and takes initiative.
* Workflow/Project Management—Sets clear, realistic, and time-bound objectives that align to business growth; breaks each objective into tasks and process steps that can be achieved within a realistic timeframe.
* Adaptability – Ability to manage multiple customer engagements simultaneously, and work with client design teams across a variety of markets and applications. Identify and communicate Microchip product differentiators targeting specific customer products.


**Travel Time**
 50% - 75%
   

  

**To all recruitment agencies** 
 :
 *Microchip Technology Inc.
 **does not** 
 accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our recruiting team or other Microchip employees. Microchip is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.*

title: Workday Module Lead
description:
**INTRODUCTION**
 Do you get excited when guiding organizations on the transformation of their HR processes based on the next generation of technology? Put your expertise to work as part of the world’s largest independent technology services provider and own the way as a trendsetter in Workday. We’re ready if you are.
   

  

**DEPARTMENT INTRODUCTION**
 The Accenture Workday Business Group is a leading partner to Workday worldwide and has a track record of implementing many of the most significant Workday projects. In addition, we take pride in advising and collaborating closely with our clients from early strategy discussions, through technology implementations and transformation programs, to support and operations. Learn more about our practice at www.accenture.com/workday.
   

  

**ARE YOU INTERESTED?**
 Do you want to work with global talent at the forefront of technological services and seek meaningful projects for top international businesses? At Accenture you have access to specifics trainings for your functional lead role. You will start with training -together with colleagues - and you will join seminars at various international locations. You will be primed, equipped and well-networked to tackle exciting projects.
   

  

 We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity.
   

  

 “Across the globe, one thing is universally true of the people of Accenture: We care deeply about what we do and the impact we have with our clients and with the communities in which we work and live. It is personal to all of us.” –
 **Julie Sweet, Accenture CEO**
**What We Offer:**
- Innovative large scale Workday projects

- A global network of talented and passionate colleagues

- Challenging work for some of the world's largest companies

- Extensive education programs and development opportunities

- Volunteering and career opportunities around the world

- A diverse and socially active workforce

- Flexible working hours and opportunity to work from home

- Friendly and social work environment

- Ability to craft your career based on your own aspirations.

**As a Workday Module Lead:**
**You'll be part of a team of advisory professionals who deliver more than just technology. From rapid deployments to complete transformations, you'll provide integrated, cloud-based HR solutions that put organizations on the fast track to a better way to work.**
**In this role, you will help our clients get the most out of their Workday investment by:**
- Collaborate with clients on industry standards and leading practices in both HCM and other Workday domains, contributing to functional solutions that meet client needs and objective and applying Workday and Accenture methodologies.

- Hosting workshops and leading discussions on topics in line with your area(s) of expertise, covering the touchpoints with other Workday functionalities.

- Independently leading your workstream and reporting on progress

- Ability to lead diverse and disparate teams and lead them through the implementation. Liaising closely with client counterparts, Accenture colleagues, and Workday to exceed client expectations

- Actively supporting innovation

**We are looking for experience in the following skills:**
- Proven experience implementing Workday HCM and/or other major modules, or relevant cloud/on-prem HR platforms

- Strong client-facing skills, with the ability to manage teams, projects, and stakeholder interactions effectively

- Ability to thrive in dynamic environments, delivering high-quality outcomes under competing priorities

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills, able to translate complex requirements into clear solutions

- Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, with professional fluency in English

  

  

**Set yourself apart:**
- Multiple Workday certifications, ideally spanning HCM and other modules (e.g., Advanced Compensation, Absence, Benefits, Talent & Performance)

- End-to-end implementation experience, with the ability to lead specific module workstreams

- Familiarity with Workday Data Migration tools and Security framework

- 2–5 years of professional Workday consulting experience

- Additional European language fluency (e.g., Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Finnish, German, French, Spanish, Dutch)

title: Senior Sales Manager (m/f/d) Invoicing as a Service
description:
Everyone's story matters. Come shape your story with us at Riverty.
   

  

**But where does that take you?**
 To one of our 30 hybrid workspaces – designed for exchanging ideas, learning from others, and shaping the way we work. An international community of over 4,000 people, representing almost 80 nationalities across 11 countries. United by one mission: Combining empathy, advanced technology and data-driven insights to keep people and businesses in flow. With payments made for them. So that they don't have to worry about it.
   

  

**And there's more:** 
 We are part of the family-owned Bertelsmann group. Established. Corporate. In a fast-paced industry. We enable flexible payments in various industries, simplifying the financial management of known brands and helping people repay debt to build financial confidence. In short: shaping FinTech.
   

  

**We are looking for a**
**(Senior) Sales Manager (m/f/d) – Invoicing as a Service**
**(unlimited, full-time) Join our team at our location in Stockholm – flexible working conditions available**
**About the Role:**
 You will spearhead the commercial delivery of Riverty’s
 **Invoicing as a Service** 
 - a modern, integrated invoice and receivables solution that streamlines the entire accounts receivable lifecycle. With over
 **60 years of expertise** 
 , we transform invoice administration, risk mitigation, and client settlement into a seamless, branded experience across
 **Sweden, Norway, Finland, and Denmark** 
 .
   

  

 You’ll benefit from a short way to internal decision makers that you will work closely with, giving you direct influence and speed in your sales process.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Drive Strategic Fintech Sales in Invoicing as a Service: Lead high-value sales cycles targeting large enterprises, financial institutions, and e-commerce organizations across the Nordics with Riverty’s comprehensive invoicing platform—offering invoice creation, payment tracking, and settlement management all in one.
* Own the Full Sales Journey: From generating pipeline and engaging stakeholders to negotiating complex contracts and closing deals—manage the sales process end-to-end with autonomy and accountability.
* Showcase Proven Sales Excellence: Demonstrate a track record in selling high contract volumes and managing complex negotiations, leveraging your strong C‑level network and deal‑closing prowess.
* Target and Cultivate Key Accounts: Identify and grow strategic partnerships throughout Sweden and the broader Nordics, introducing consultative fintech solutions that elevate clients’ invoice lifecycle management.
* Evangelize the Product: Represent Riverty’s IaaS offerings at industry forums, thought leadership events, and client gatherings—sharing insights on digital invoicing, embedded finance, and branded receivables automation.
* Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with commercial, marketing, key account management, legal, risk, and operations teams to tailor IaaS solutions that match client needs and drive product innovation.
* Shape Product Development: Channel client feedback and market trends into product enhancements, especially around modern debtor communications, API integration, and flexible branded invoice experiences.


**Your Profile**
* Fintech Sales Expertise: Minimum 5 years of B2B sales in fintech or invoicing/accounting-related services—especially within the Nordics or enterprise software sectors.
* High‑Volume, High‑Complexity Deals: Demonstrable success in closing large contracts, negotiating complex terms, and delivering results.
* Nordic Market Knowledge: Deep understanding of invoicing, receivables management, and regulatory environments in Sweden, Norway, Finland, and Denmark.
* C‑Level Engagement: Strong professional network with proven ability to navigate and influence senior stakeholders across organizations.
* Strategic Selling Methodologies: Fluent in consultative, challenger, or solution-selling approaches for fintech offerings.
* Tech‑Savvy & Data‑Driven: Experience with API‑centric products, CRM/ERP integration, and presenting data‑backed proposals.
* Language Proficiency: Professional English, but any Nordic language is a strong plus


 Equal Opportunity Employer Statement
   

  

 We want to be a fair and inclusive employer. We value the diverse perspectives that a diverse workforce brings to the table. Therefore, we are actively looking for people who enrich our company through their identity, background and personal experiences, with or without a disability.
   

  

**Benefits:**
* At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
* Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
* Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
* Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
* With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

title: HRBP & ER Manager Sweden
description:
**Job Description**
 Become a key player in shaping the future of our people strategy across the Nordics! We’re looking for a passionate and experienced HR professional to lead our HR operations and drive impactful change across Sweden, Finland, Denmark, and Norway.
   

  

* Location: Based in one of our Nordic locations, with regular travel across the region to support our teams and business leaders.


**Ideal Candidate:**
 Are you a strategic HR leader with a hands-on mindset and a passion for building strong, people-first organizations? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, matrixed environment and enjoy partnering with senior leaders to drive business success? If so, this role is tailor-made for you!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Your Role and How You’ll Make a Difference:**
 As
 **Senior HR Manager Nordics** 
 , you’ll lead our HR teams in Sweden and Finland, and oversee HR operations in Denmark and Norway through trusted partners. You’ll be the go-to expert for all things people-related in the region.
   

  

* Lead and Inspire: Manage and develop HR teams, driving performance, engagement, and growth.
* Drive Change: Lead large-scale transformation initiatives and cultural improvements across the region.
* Partner with Purpose: Collaborate with business leaders to align HR strategies with organizational goals.
* Champion Compliance: Ensure adherence to local labor laws and corporate policies.
* Foster Relationships: Build strong partnerships with Works Councils and Union representatives.
* Deliver Excellence: Oversee recruitment, talent management, compensation, employee relations, and more.
* Collaborate Globally: Work closely with EMEA and global HR teams to implement corporate programs and initiatives.


**Qualifications**
**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or related field (Master’s/MBA preferred)
* Proven experience in a senior HR role across multiple countries, ideally in a manufacturing or matrixed multinational environment
* Strong leadership and team development skills
* Deep knowledge of local labor laws and HR best practices
* Fluent in Swedish and English; other Nordic languages are a plus
* IT-savvy and experienced with HRIS systems
* Willingness to travel regularly across the region


**What We Offer:**
 At Sherwin-Williams, we believe our people are our greatest strength. In return for your expertise, we offer:
   

  

* A senior HR role with regional impact
* A collaborative and inclusive culture
* Competitive salary and benefits
* Opportunities for continuous learning and career growth
* The chance to lead HR strategy in a dynamic, international environment


**Please note that Sherwin Williams is unable to respond to any enquiries, accept CVs or applications from Recruitment Agencies.**
**About Us**
